Articles.Content:
The Apollo is looking very nice. Are you doing the whole program? (LEM, Saturn V etc)

Thanks for your efforts!

only CSM. But maybe i'll do the whole program with Saturn 5 and etc.
P.S. i tried to attach CSM+LM form Apollo mission pack beta to Worlds Space Saturn 5, it was fine... probably you can do same with your Apollo...
MORE BOOLEAN!

Found a picture, but it doesn't show which parts do what.

The thing to the left is a tug, designed for taking it all to the moon. It is launched seperately and docks in LEO (LKO for KSP, obviously). The thing "below" the PPTS capsule, I don't know what is, but I guess it's a lander engine. It might stay on the moon, or the pod might decouple and fly home itself. I have no idea.

Also, you should really do an Apollo MEM, even if you don't do a Saturn V. We can already make something that looks like a Saturn V with novapunch, even though it won't be perfect.

He's already making a LEM, from the looks of it. Also, the thing below PPTS is just a Block DM with an adapter. This is not a landing mission, but rather a circumlunar one. Also, it's only one configuration. Here you can find more data on various space tug launch variants: http://www.russianspaceweb.com/ptk_2013.html

He's already making a LEM, from the looks of it. Also, the thing below PPTS is just a Block DM with an adapter. This is not a landing mission, but rather a circumlunar one. Also, it's only one configuration. Here you can find more data on various space tug launch variants: http://www.russianspaceweb.com/ptk_2013.html

Thank you for pointing me back towards that site, I'd seen it before, but couldn't find it again.
Will the csm have the fold out antenna will it be polished silver and I didnt like the saturn V from world space it seemed a little off but thats just my opinion
any plans to make this configuration IVA http://youtu.be/yshuEEuw4jU ?

any plans to make this configuration IVA http://youtu.be/yshuEEuw4jU ?

It looks like wrong IVA structure. Anyway i not going to recreate IVA right now.

PPTS released!

That's great! However, the 3d-model of PPTS is outdated

Final version looks like this (LEO):

http://www.russianspaceweb.com/ptk_2012.html

In lunar version instrumental module is twice longer.
Nope, it's the same spacecraft that's used by the LEOversion, just with a Block D attached.

Hello. I just wanted you to know that I made rextextured parts of BobCat's Soyuz rocket to better match your Vostok and its fairings. If you would like I can give you them, however Im not sure Im allowed to considering that they're simply modified versions of BobCat's. They're just recolored anyways. I can give you a screenshot if you like.

@Dragon01: Nope, equeim is right. MrTheBull modelled the old PTK design. The new 2013 design doesn't have that bump with docking windows (or RCS on this model), heatshield in on the bottom and it is landing with a parachute.
What's next after Apollo? Some more Russian probes?

What's next after Apollo? Some more Russian probes?

My plans on future:

  • Update PPTS with new colliders and some new textures
  • Apollo CSM release
  • Different variants of soyuz (dragon's request)
  • Angara?
  • Venera?
  • Opsek
Are there any plans on adding a clickable periscope/camera system for the PPTS?

Are there any plans on adding a clickable periscope/camera system for the PPTS?

i can't do this

i can't do this

I mixed up. I meant the PTK NP.

I mixed up. I meant the PTK NP.

i get it. But i really don't know how to do this. And what do you mean? Window or what?
You can make a clickable region that can change the camera view. Would be nice to have a small "camera" for docking as well as various viewpoints.
For example. Bobcat's TMA Descent Module. While in IVA, if you double click on the periscope, you get an outside view of the capsule:

For example. Bobcat's TMA Descent Module. While in IVA, if you double click on the periscope, you get an outside view of the capsule:

Hmm. Never noticed. But bobcat's soyuz has vzor. But PTK np doesn't have it.

I'm trying to create RD-191, but now it looks like a ****

I found some more photos and going to recreate it.
to me it looks very good :/
I think it looks good, too. I couldn't top it, although I might be able to get up on par with it... if I invested 5+ hours in a model.
